body: @jonathanslenders have you seen this before? Error 10038 is 'Socket operation on nonsocket.' - i.e. it's trying to select() on something that isn't selectable on Windows.

I may got a similar error:

Traceback (most recent call last):

    "__main__", fname, loader, pkg_name)
  File "c:\python27\lib\runpy.py", line 72, in _run_code

    app.start()
  File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\IPython\terminal\ipapp.py", line 348, in start
    self.shell.mainloop()
  File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\IPython\terminal\interactiveshell.py", line 402, in mainloop

    select_fds([self._r], timeout=None)
  File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\prompt_toolkit\eventloop\select.py", line 49, in select_fds
    result = _select(read_fds, timeout)
  File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\prompt_toolkit\eventloop\select.py", line 99, in _select

error: (10038, 'An operation was attempted on something that is not a socket')

If you suspect this is an IPython bug, please report it at:
    https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues
or send an email to the mailing list at ipython-dev@scipy.org

You can print a more detailed traceback right now with "%tb", or use "%debug"
to interactively debug it.

Extra-detailed tracebacks for bug-reporting purposes can be enabled via:
    %config Application.verbose_crash=True

From the sudden influx of errors, I suspect that this bug was introduced by [this prompt_toolkit commit](https://github.com/jonathanslenders/python-prompt-toolkit/commit/ac26b0257427285ae20aa893da08e0f64b824d4d) working around a gevent bug.

I'm also guessing that it only shows up on Python 2: because of the exception reorganisation that took place in Python 3.3, the error in Python 3 is probably a subclass of `OSError`, and so it gets caught.
Can you try installing prompt_toolkit from my pull request at jonathanslenders/python-prompt-toolkit#368? I think that should make it work.

Prompt_toolkit 1.0.5 has been released. Can you do `pip install -U prompt_toolkit` and try again?
Excuse me for the inconvenience!
Closing as this should be fixed - thanks Jonathan.
thank you Jonathan and Takluyver, problem solved
